page.title: 05Population _ Leck area
page.content: Population has gone down a lot from what it was in the past.The number of farm workrs has gone down because machinery has taken over.There used to be three shops but now there is just one because we have got cars and other vehicles to travel to places like Kirkby,Kendal and Lancaster.Houses have been made into holiday cottages and in the winter months they stand empty.There aren't so many servants in big houses any more because of the equipment for example,hoovers,washing machines and irons etc.These are some of the reasons why the population has fallen.In Cowan Bridge,Leck,Over Town and Burrow,in the census returns for 1881 there were 174 adults and 85 children.In the 1985 Register of Electors there are about 76 adults and 22 children.
